PW PC #1 -- Prop.#1- 1 Mill - PC - 10 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
Proposition No. 1
(Tax Renewal)

Summary:  10 year 1 mill property renewal tax for acquiring, constructing, improving, maintaining and operating an animal shelter for the Parish, including necessary equipment and facilities therefor.
Race.FullText: Shall the Parish of St. Tammany, State of Louisiana (the "Parish"), levy a one (1) mill tax on all the property subject to taxation in the Parish (an estimated $1,092,700 reasonably expected at this time to be collected from the levy of the Tax for an entire year) for a period of ten (10) years, beginning with the year 2009 and ending with the year 2018, for the purpose of acquiring, constructing, improving, maintaining and operating an animal shelter for the Parish, including necessary equipment and facilities therefor?

Race.SpecificTitle: PW PC #2 -- Prop.#2 - 2 Mills - PC - 10 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
Proposition No. 2
(Tax Renewal)

Summary:  10 year 2 mills property tax renewal for programs of social welfare to be dedicated (1) 50% for acquiring, constructing, improving, maintaining and operating authorized activities, services, programs and/or facilities of and for the St. Tammany Parish Council on Aging and (2) 50% for acquiring, constructing, improving, maintaining and operating authorized activities, services, programs and/or facilities for individuals with mental retardation and/or disabled persons in the Parish.
Race.FullText: Shall the Parish of St. Tammany, State of Louisiana (the "Parish"), levy a two (2) mills tax on all the property subject to taxation in the Parish (an estimated $2,185,400 reasonably expected at this time to be collected from the levy of the Tax for an entire year) for a period of ten (10) years, beginning with the year 2009 and ending with the year 2018, for programs of social welfare with the avails to be dedicated as follows: (i) 50% for the purpose of providing funds for acquiring, constructing, improving, maintaining and operating authorized activities, services, programs and/or facilities of and for the St. Tammany Parish Council on Aging, and (ii) 50% for the purpose of providing funds for acquiring, constructing, improving, maintaining and operating authorized activities, services, programs and/or facilities for individuals with mental retardation and/or disabled persons in the Parish?

Race.SpecificTitle: Road Lighting Dist. No.5 -- 5 Mills - PC - 10 Yr.
Race.SummaryText:
Road Lighting District No. 5 Proposition
 (Millage Renewal)

Summary: 10 year, 5 mills property tax renewal for providing and maintaining electric lights on the streets, roads, highways, alleys and public places in Road Lighting District No. 5.
Race.FullText: Shall Road Lighting District No. 5 of the Parish of St. Tammany, State of Louisiana (the "District"), levy a special tax of five (5) mills, on all the property subject to taxation in the District for a period of ten (10) years, beginning with the year 2010 and ending with the year 2019 (an estimated $20,000 reasonably expected at this time to be collected from the levy of the Tax for an entire year), for the purpose of providing and maintaining electric lights on the streets, roads, highways, alleys and public places in the District?

Race.SpecificTitle: Sewerage District No. 6 -- $896,000 Sewerage System Sale - BOS
Race.SummaryText:
Sewerage District No. 6 Proposition
(Sewerage System Sale)

Summary:  Authority for Sewerage District No. 6 of the Parish of St. Tammany, State of Louisiana (the "District"), to sell the District's sewerage collection lines and appurtenant equipment and furnishings to Utilities, Inc. (the "Purchaser"), as per the written proposal dated as of June 18, 2008, which provides generally for the sale of said facilities to the purchaser for an amount of approximately $896,000, with the net proceeds derived from such sale, after payment of expenses, adjustments and any mutually agreed reductions, to be used to retire or defease the outstanding indebtedness of the District with the remaining proceeds to be transferred to the District for expenditures for any lawful purpose.
Race.FullText: Shall Sewerage District No. 6 of the Parish of St. Tammany, State of Louisiana (the "District"), under the authority of Sub-Part A, Part III, Chapter 10, Title 33 of the Louisiana Revised Statutes of 1950, as amended, be authorized to sell the District's sewerage collection lines and appurtenant equipment and furnishings to Utilities, Inc. (the "Purchaser"), as per the written proposal dated as of June 18, 2008, on file in the office of the District at St. Tammany Sewer District No. 6,19432A Hwy. 36, Covington, Louisiana, and available for public inspection, which proposal provides generally for the sale of said facilities to the Purchaser for an amount of approximately $896,000, with the net proceeds derived from such sale, after payment of expenses, adjustments and mutually agreed reductions, to be used to retire or defease the outstanding indebtedness of the District with the remaining proceeds to be transferred to the District for expenditures for any lawful purpose?

Race.SpecificTitle: Fire Prot. Dist. No. 3 -- 10 Mills - BOC - 10 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
Fire Protection District No. 3 Proposition 
(Millage Renewal)

Summary:  10 year, 10 mills property tax renewal for St. Tammany Fire Protection District No. 3 for acquiring, constructing, improving, maintaining and operating fire protection and emergency medical service facilities, vehicles and equipment, including both movable and immovable property, to be used by the District in providing fire protection and emergency medical service.
Race.FullText: Shall Fire Protection District No. 3 of the Parish of St. Tammany, State of Louisiana (the "District"), levy a special tax of ten (10) mills on all property subject to taxation in the District for a period of ten (10) years, commencing with the year 2010 and ending with the year 2019 (an estimated $327,000 reasonably expected at this time to be collected from the levy of the Tax for an entire year), for the purpose of acquiring, constructing, improving, maintaining and operating fire protection and emergency medical service facilities, vehicles and equipment, including both movable and immovable property, to be used by the District in providing fire protection and emergency medical service?
